verses.verse: So I<WH589> returned,<WH7725> and considered<WH7200> <WH853> all<WH3605> the oppressions<WH6217> that<WH834> are done<WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun:<WH8121> and behold<WH2009> the tears<WH1832> of such as were oppressed,<WH6217> and they had no<WH369> comforter;<WH5162> and on the side<WH4480> <WH3027> of their oppressors<WH6231> there was power;<WH3581> but they had no<WH369> comforter.<WH5162>
Wherefore I<WH589> praised<WH7623> <WH853> the dead<WH4191> which are already<WH7945> <WH3528> dead<WH4191> more than<WH4480> the living<WH2416> which<WH834> <WH1992> are yet<WH5728> alive.<WH2416>

Yea, better<WH2896> is he than both<WH4480> <WH8147> they,<WH853> which<WH834> hath not<WH3808> yet<WH5728> been,<WH1961> who<WH834> hath not<WH3808> seen<WH7200> <WH853> the evil<WH7451> work<WH4639> that<WH834> is done<WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

Again, I<WH589> considered<WH7200> <WH853> all<WH3605> travail,<WH5999> and every<WH3605> right<WH3788> work,<WH4639> that<WH3588> for this<WH1931> a man<WH376> is envied<WH7068> of his neighbor.<WH4480> <WH7453> This<WH2088> is also<WH1571> vanity<WH1892> and vexation<WH7469> of spirit.<WH7307>
The fool<WH3684> foldeth his hands together,<WH2263> <WH853> <WH3027> and eateth<WH398> <WH853> his own flesh.<WH1320>
Better <WH2896> is a handful<WH4480> <WH4393> <WH3709> with quietness,<WH5183> than both the hands<WH2651> full<WH4480> <WH4393> with travail<WH5999> and vexation<WH7469> of spirit.<WH7307>
Then I<WH589> returned,<WH7725> and I saw<WH7200> vanity<WH1892> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

There is<WH3426> one<WH259> alone, and there is not<WH369> a second;<WH8145> yea,<WH1571> he hath neither<WH369> child<WH1121> nor brother:<WH251> yet is there no<WH369> end<WH7093> of all<WH3605> his labor;<WH5999> neither<WH3808> is his eye<WH5869> satisfied<WH7646> with riches;<WH6239> neither saith he, For whom<WH4310> do I<WH589> labor,<WH6001> and bereave<WH2637> <WH853> my soul<WH5315> of good?<WH4480> <WH2896> This<WH2088> is also<WH1571> vanity,<WH1892> yea, it<WH1931> is a sore<WH7451> travail.<WH6045>
Two <WH8147> are better<WH2896> than<WH4480> one;<WH259> because<WH834> they have<WH3426> a good<WH2896> reward<WH7939> for their labor.<WH5999>

For <WH3588> if<WH518> they fall,<WH5307> the one<WH259> will lift up<WH6965> <WH853> his fellow:<WH2270> but woe<WH337> to him that is alone<WH259> when he falleth;<WH7945> <WH5307> for he hath not<WH369> another<WH8145> to help him up.<WH6965>
Again, <WH1571> if<WH518> two<WH8147> lie together,<WH7901> then they have heat:<WH2552> but how<WH349> can one<WH259> be warm<WH3179> alone?
And if<WH518> one<WH259> prevail against<WH8630> him, two<WH8147> shall withstand<WH5975> <WH5048> him; and a threefold<WH8027> cord<WH2339> is not<WH3808> quickly<WH4120> broken.<WH5423>

Better <WH2896> is a poor<WH4542> and a wise<WH2450> child<WH3206> than an old<WH2205> and foolish<WH3684> king,<WH4480> <WH4428> who<WH834> will<WH3045> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> be admonished.<WH2094>
For <WH3588> out of prison<WH4480> <WH1004> <WH631> he cometh<WH3318> to reign;<WH4427> whereas<WH3588> also<WH1571> he that is born<WH3205> in his kingdom<WH4438> becometh poor.<WH7326>

I considered<WH7200> <WH853> all<WH3605> the living<WH2416> which walk<WH1980> under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> with<WH5973> the second<WH8145> child<WH3206> that<WH834> shall stand up<WH5975> in his stead.<WH8478>

There is no<WH369> end<WH7093> of all<WH3605> the people,<WH5971> even of all<WH3605> that<WH834> have been<WH1961> before<WH6440> them: they also<WH1571> that come after<WH314> shall not<WH3808> rejoice<WH8055> in him. Surely<WH3588> this<WH2088> also<WH1571> is vanity<WH1892> and vexation<WH7475> of spirit.<WH7307>
